alert.note: Alert for Blount; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 3:36PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Blount and central St. Clair Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 336 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Springville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Springville, Ashville, Riverside, Ragland, Logan Martin Lake, Highland Lake, Whitney Junction, St. Clair Springs, Wattsville, Holly Springs, Caldwell, Horse Pens Forty and I 59 Rest Areas At Oneonta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
